summary: Kyra Defourny is a post doctoral scientist specialized in the study of extracellular vesicles (EVs). In her academic work, Kyra aims to address fundamental research questions regarding the release and function of EVs during infection, inflammation, and/or cell stress. Recently Kyra finished her PhD on the release of EV-enclosed picornaviruses, focusing on the virus-host interactions promoting the uptake of virus particles into EVs. By looking at virus infection, we can learn more about the regulation of EV release and the properties of EVs. Vice versa, knowledge on EVs is crucial to understand the properties of EV-enclosed viruses as long overlooked infectious agents during infection. Following up on her work Kyra is currently doing a post doc on the impact of virus infection on EV fusion efficiency, using novel microscopy-based reporter assays.
